data.text: Job spoke again,
“I wish/desire that I could be like I was previously,
During those years, it was as though God’s lamp [MET] shone on me
At that time I was young and strong,
Almighty God was with me during those years
My herds provided me with plenty of milk,
“Whenever I went to the place where the elders gathered at the city gate,
and when the young men saw me, they stepped aside respectfully,
The leaders of the people stopped talking [DOU],
and even the most important men became quiet
When they [SYN] all heard what I told them,
because I had helped the poor people when they cried out for help
Those who were suffering and about to die praised [PRS] me,
I always acted justly;
It was as though [MET] I was eyes for blind people
I was like [MET] a father to poor people,
My causing wicked people to be unable to continue oppressing others was like [MET] breaking the fangs of fierce wild animals
“At that time I thought, ‘Surely I will live securely, until I am very old [SIM],
I was like a tree [MET] whose roots reach down into the water
People always honored me,
“When I spoke, people waited to hear what I would say
After I finished speaking, they did not say any more;
They waited for me to speak like they wait for rain;
When they were discouraged, I smiled at them to encourage them;
I was their leader, and I decided what things would be good for them to do;
